head.title: More Options for Miles Without Flying

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: More Options for Miles Without Flying

abstract.p: America West and MCI WorldCom, Continental Airlines and AT&T, United Airlines and Abercrombie & Kent and Best Western and Northwest Airlines form alliances to offer travelers frequent flyer miles without boarding an airplane (S)

block.p: Several new partnerships have been formed that allow travelers to earn frequent flier miles without boarding an airplane. America West has joined forces with MCI WorldCom, and Continental Airlines has changed its long-distance alliance from M.C.I. to AT&T. United Airlines has formed a partnership with Abercrombie & Kent, a tour operator specializing in adventure travel, and Best Western is Northwest Airlines' newest hotel partner.

America West Airlines' FlightFund members earn miles for their MCI WorldCom phone use, with five miles for every dollar spent on MCI WorldCom services, such as long distance, local toll service and calling-card calls. New MCI customers are eligible for bonuses of 1,000 miles a month for the next two months and an additional 1,000 miles for online enrollment. For information and to enroll, call (877) 624-3863.

Members of Continental Airlines' frequent flier program now receive five OnePass miles for each dollar spent on residential long distance calls made through AT&T. For information and enrollment, call (800) 255-4600.

United Airlines program members who book Abercrombie & Kent vacation packages from one of seven brochures through Dec. 31, and complete the trip by the end of 2001, are eligible for 5,000 Mileage Plus miles. For reservations, call (800) 323-7308.

Participants in Northwest Airlines' frequent flier plan receive 250 WorldPerks miles for each stay at a Best Western International hotel in North, Central or South America. For reservations, call (800) 937-8376.
